result.execSummary:
The defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 10 days Rock Co Jail in lieu of $443 costs, consecutive to jail sentence, concurrent with any other sentence.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Bernard Eugene Erwin

records.addlTxt: Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Miguel Adolfo Michel.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  No contest plea, Court finds defendant guilty.  Court orders 9 months Rock Co Jail, concurrent with 14CF1316; 10 consecutive days Rock Co Jail in lieu of costs; no Huber; 156 days sentence credit.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Miguel A. Michel.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Jason M. Daane.  Anne Theresa Nack appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Daane moves to withdraw; Court grants motion.  Public Defender to appoint new counsel.  Status conference scheduled for October 30, 2014 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Jason M. Daane.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Set trial dates based on previously entered demand for speedy trial.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 16, 2014 at 11:00 am.  Jury selection scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for October 27, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on September 4, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Kelly James Mattingly.  Katharine Buker and intern Kerra Stumbris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Information filed; Copy to Defendant; Reading waived.  Defense makes oral speedy trial demand.  Deft stands mute; not guilty plea entered by court; jury trial to be set.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Jason M. Daane.  Mark M. Jahnke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Testimony taken; Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Arraignment scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Bernard Eugene Erwin in court in custody with attorney Richard L. Jones.  Jodi Dabson Bollendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed; Copy to Deft; Penalties advised; Rights given; Reading waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014, at 9:00 am.
